content.full_text: Abraham Lincoln to William Thomas, 25 March 18521
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to William Thomas, 25 March 18521
citations:
Roy P. Basler, ed.,The Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln(Westport, CT: Greenwood, 1974), 10:22-23; For Thomas' cases involving Lincoln, search
                     “Thomas, William,” Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter.

2No other correspondence between Lincoln and William Thomas has been located for the
                  year 1852. Thomas frequently collaborated with Lincoln, but neither Roy P. Basler,
                  editor ofThe Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln, nor the editors have been able to clarify the Shawneetown matters.Roy P. Basler, ed.,The Collected Works of Abraham Lincoln(Westport, CT: Greenwood, 1974), 10:22-23; For Thomas' cases involving Lincoln, search
                     “Thomas, William,” Martha L. Benner and Cullom Davis et al., eds.,The Law Practice of Abraham Lincoln: Complete Documentary Edition, 2d edition (Springfield: Illinois Historic Preservation Agency, 2009),http://www.lawpracticeofabrahamlincoln.org.
